title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
The board is clean, However, I have a short to ground on:
 PPBUS_G3H,0.9-0.4  ohm
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS 0.9-0.4  ohm
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS 0.9-0.4  ohm

Is the CPU dead ? What to do ?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
PPBUS, is PPBUS; no need to test in different points.
Check if any big coils has the same resistance to ground; usually CPU ones.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Big coils are good,  the closest are:  
L7310 - 12 ohm 
L7320 - 12 ohm

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Then is safe to inject voltage.
Set lab PSU amp limit to max first.
Start injecting 1V and slowly go up, if needed.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message: 4v and nothing. Can I give more volts ?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message: What is the current indicated by PSU?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
"3- 0"
ACIN is missing, fix the problem.
Check diode mode to ground first.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
diode mode
3 -  0

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Remove C7111.
If still short, change U7100.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
"2- 7"
So U7100 is not correctly powered up.
Replace it and check R/D7105 too.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message: I noticed that ppbus grows slowly from 0.6 to 1.7

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
"2- 5.4"
PPDCIN_G3H and PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL voltage?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
PPDCIN_G3H 16.2
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL 16.2

But diode mode F7140
pin 1 - 0,125
pin 2 - 0,460
Is it just a burnt fuse ?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
F7140 is burnt.
But you still have a problem with R/C/D7105, or U7100.
You cannot lost 10.8V over R/D7105; at least R7105 is damaged.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
I replaced the D7105  and it starts but will not power on with battery power.
C7116:
pin 1 - 1,4 v
pin 2 - 8,6 v
R7151 and  R7152 pin1/2 - 8.6 v
I tried a new battery and a pram reset.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
So it doesn't start with battery only?
Do you get 3V42_G3H then?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Yes. 
PP3V42_G3H - 3,42 v

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Is the battery charging now?
Did you try known good battery?

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message: I changed the batteries. MacBook sees the battery, will charge the battery until full but will shut off immediately if it is unplugged from the AC adapte.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
3V42_G3H surely present on battery alone (without charger)?
Also post PPBUS_G3H without charger (only battery).

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Only battery
PPBUS_G3H 0v
3V42_G3H 0v

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
"So it doesn't start with battery only?
Do you get 3V42_G3H then?
------------------
Yes.
PP3V42_G3H - 3,42 v
--------------------
Only battery
PPBUS_G3H 0v
3V42_G3H 0v"
Pay more atention and gain time!!!
You are the first interested.

Now change Q7155.
Also check R6950.

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
Sorry for the confusion.

I replaced Q7155&R6950 and still the same

title: 820-00165 PPBUS_G3H short
message:
If battery has some charge and R6950 is good, then PPBUS_G3H must appear.
Try known good battery.
